value.title: Hear Trump's response to the FBI's raid of Rudy Giuliani
value.excerpt: Former President Donald Trump reacts in a Fox Business interview after federal investigators executed a search warrant at the home and office of Rudy Giuliani.

value.title: Kamala Harris agrees with Tim Scott that the US is not racist, but says racism must not be ignored
value.excerpt: Vice President Kamala Harris on Thursday agreed with South Carolina Sen. Tim Scott that the United States is not a racist country, but added that the nation has a history of racism that cannot be overlooked.

value.title: Uproar over Mike Pence's memoir highlights growing conflicts in publishing, experts say
value.excerpt: When the publishing giant Simon & Schuster recently announced it would release former Vice President Mike Pence’s autobiography, the decision evidently infuriated rank-and-file workers, who reportedly submitted a petition demanding the company stop ...

value.title: Biden's pick to serve on powerful DC-based appellate says her experience as a Black jurist 'might be valuable' if confirmed
value.excerpt: Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson, President Joe Biden's pick to fill a vacancy on a powerful DC-based appellate court, said at a Senate hearing Wednesday that her race doesn't play a role in her work as a judge, but that her experience as an African American jurist "might be valuable" should she be confirmed

value.title: 'Not an easy transition': Inside Trump's unconventional first months out of office
value.excerpt: Most Mondays and Tuesdays, former President Donald Trump skips golf to confer with aides about the week ahead.

value.title: Here's what's in Biden's $1.8 trillion American Families Plan
value.excerpt: A month after he laid out a roughly $2 trillion infrastructure plan aimed at helping the nation recover from the coronavirus pandemic, President Joe Biden is set to unveil an additional $1.8 trillion federal investment in education, child care and paid family leave during his first address to Congress

value.title: New York Post temporarily deletes, then edits false story that claimed Harris' book was given out in migrant 'welcome kits'
value.excerpt: The New York Post temporarily deleted, and then edited and republished, a debunked article that falsely claimed that copies of Vice President Kamala Harris' book were being included in "welcome kits" given to migrant children at a shelter in Long Beach, California.

value.title: Analysis: The Trump Republican circus gears up for another tour
value.excerpt: Donald Trump schooled his protégés well in his politics of down-in-the-muck misinformation.

value.title: Kamala Harris cements her place in Biden's inner circle during a consequential week
value.excerpt: Vice President Kamala Harris was huddled with other White House officials in President Joe Biden's private dining room last week when the room let out a "collective exhale." A Minnesota jury had found Derek Chauvin guilty of murdering George Floyd.

value.title: Pop is calling: Kids and grandkids on the line with President Joe Biden
value.excerpt: Joe Biden says he has a strict rule about his phone: No matter what's happening, he always answers a call from one of his grandchildren.

value.title: ICE ends Trump-era policy of fining undocumented immigrants, calling penalties 'ineffective'
value.excerpt: Immigration and Customs Enforcement will no longer issue fines to undocumented immigrants who have failed to depart the United States, the agency announced Friday, a reversal from the Trump-era policy that threatened immigrants with thousands of dollars in debt to the federal government.

value.title: Biden set to make maiden foreign trip in June to UK and Belgium
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden will embark upon his first foreign trip in June, the White House said on Friday, with plans to attend the Group of 7 summit in southwestern England and diplomatic meetings in Brussels.

value.title: Biden announces US will aim to cut carbon emissions by as much as 52% by 2030 at virtual climate summit
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden on Thursday will kick off a climate summit attended by 40 other world leaders by announcing an ambitious cut in greenhouse gas emissions as he looks to put the US back at the center of the global effort to address the climate crisis and curb carbon emissions.

value.title: New probe confirms Trump officials blocked Puerto Rico from receiving hurricane aid
value.excerpt: Findings from a new inspector general report show how Trump officials blocked hurricane aid for Puerto Rico and obstructed a probe looking into the withholdings.

value.title: 'Outrageous': Bank regulator lobbies for Trump-era rule, angering Democrats
value.excerpt: Consumer watchdogs have warned that it could unleash predatory loans by enabling "payday" lenders to evade state interest rate caps.

value.title: With Trump's backing, Walker freezes Senate GOP field in Georgia
value.excerpt: Former President Donald Trump's backing of football great Herschel Walker to run for the Georgia Senate seat has been enough to effectively freeze the GOP field in place -- even though some Republicans privately worry the political neophyte might fizzle against Sen. Raphael Warnock in a high-stakes general

value.title: The Trump admin awarded a firm up to $1.3 billion to make Covid vaccine syringes. Where are they?
value.excerpt: The Trump admin awarded a firm up to $1.3 billion to make Covid vaccine syringes. Where are they? The Covid vaccines are here, but the ApiJect syringe is not yet approved by federal regulators. WASHINGTON — A year after a Connecticut company was awarded federal loans and contracts worth up to nearly $1.

value.title: Pelosi felt 'liberated' after ripping up Trump's 2020 State of the Union speech, author says
value.excerpt: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi felt "liberated" when she ripped up a copy of President Donald Trump's State of the Union address last year, but the move was largely unplanned simply because she couldn't find a pen,

value.title: Biden preparing to declare massacre of Armenians a 'genocide,' risking break with Turkey
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden is preparing to declare the massacre of an estimated million or more Armenians under the Ottoman Empire a "genocide" this week, risking a potential fracture with Turkey but fulfilling a campaign pledge to finally use the word as President to describe the mass killings after a series

value.title: 'I stay up nights': Afghans working for US worry about their future after Biden withdrawal announcement
value.excerpt: Khan's family is under threat, he's no longer going to his job site, and he's swapping sleeping schedules with his pregnant wife to keep watch.

value.title: Andrew Giuliani to meet with Trump as he preps NY gubernatorial bid
value.excerpt: Andrew Giuliani, the son of former New York City Mayor Rudy Giuliani and a former public liaison official inside the Trump White House, will meet with the former President at Mar-a-Lago next week as he finalizes his plans to launch a campaign for New York governor.

value.title: 8 Podcasts to Help Make Sense of Post-Trump America
value.excerpt: In the wake of a most untraditional presidency, these shows will keep you up-to-date on what’s happening in Washington and our politically polarized country.

value.title: Foxconn plant, once touted by Trump as a 13,000-job juggernaut, will now create just 1,500 jobs
value.excerpt: Taiwan electronics manufacturer Foxconn is drastically scaling back a planned $10 billion factory in Wisconsin, confirming its retreat from a project that former President Donald Trump once called "the eighth wonder of the world.

value.title: Durbin wants more info on Trump appointees 'burrowed' into career Justice Dept. jobs
value.excerpt: The Illinois senator, citing NBC News' reporting, requested info on Trump appointees who landed career civil service jobs at the Executive Office of Immigration Review.

value.title: Biden called George Floyd's brother as nation awaits verdict in Derek Chauvin trial
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden called George Floyd's brother Philonise Floyd on Monday as his family and the nation await a verdict in the trial of former Minneapolis police Officer Derek Chauvin.

value.title: Washington Post: Trump-installed NSA lawyer resigns after being on administrative leave for three months
value.excerpt: National Security Agency general counsel Michael Ellis, who was installed by Trump officials in the final days of the administration, resigned from his post on Friday after being on administrative leave since the start of the Biden administration, according to The Washington Post.

value.title: Biden takes on Democrats’ ‘Mission Impossible’: Revitalizing coal country
value.excerpt: Despite deep skepticism from union allies, Democrats are determined to make their “Just Transition” away from fossil fuels work.

value.title: White House tells refugee advocates Biden likely to raise cap quickly
value.excerpt: White House officials signaled in a conference call with refugee resettlement advocates late Friday that President Joe Biden is likely to raise the current refugee cap of 15,000 quickly, well ahead of the May 15 deadline set Friday, according to a person familiar with the matter.

value.title: Florida woman charged for allegedly threatening to kill Kamala Harris
value.excerpt: A Miami woman has been charged for allegedly threatening to kill Vice President Kamala Harris, according to a criminal complaint filed in the United States District Court for the Southern District of Florida.

value.title: Biden says Iran enriching uranium at 60% is not helpful, but is pleased country engaging in indirect talks
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden on Friday said Iran's decision to enrich uranium at 60% is not helpful and counter to the agreement the countries made under the Iran nuclear deal, but said he is pleased the country continues to engage in indirect talks with the United States.
